description: From Ancient Greek παραλληλεπίπεδος (parallēlepípedos, “with parallel surfaces”), from παράλληλος (parállēlos, “parallel”) + ἐπίπεδος (epípedos, “plane”).

entries.meaning: (geometry) A solid figure, having six faces, all parallelograms, all opposite faces being similar and parallel.
examples: A cuboid is a rectangular parallelepiped.
